title: Digital Animation, T constructivist: The New York Times Style Magazine, 2007
title_raw: T constructivist: The New York Times Style Magazine
description: Digitial animation featuring parts of a capital letter "T" rearranging into different figures amidst the sound of cheering and flashing light bulbs.
justification: Although silkscreen poster design remains a central part of Philippe Apeloig’s practice, he also constantly creates work in the field of moving graphics. This playful animation, designed for T: The New York Times Style Magazine, transforms the magazine’s “T” logo into a myriad of figures. Its soundtrack features the astonished cheers and flashbulbs associated with a celebrity’s arrival on a red carpet. Apeloig uses this digital medium to its fullest potential, deconstructing this single letter into a series of abstract shapes that are constantly reinvented.

tombstone.epitaph: Digital Animation, T constructivist: The New York Times Style Magazine, 2007. digital animation, 2 mn. Gift of Philippe Apeloig. 2013-16-6.
